result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven A Stence was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
$200.00 cash bond applied. 
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Must participate in psychological evaluation. Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

timeConds.notes: Court grants work release and work search. Court grants credit for 16 days if revoked from probation.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Concurrent with: 17CF153.

superMiscConds.notes: Must maintain absolute sobriety. Contact with the mother of his child is to be up to the Probation Agent.
Must undergo a psychological evaluation. Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Oustanding financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment.
